subject: Re: Problems running JUnit
msgSnippet: Hi Lasse, I think it works now. At least I get output in the commandline like this: JUnit version 4.1 .E Time: 0,01 There was 1 failure: 1) TestX
messageBody:
Hi Lasse,

I think it works now.
At least I get output in the commandline like this:
JUnit version 4.1
.E
Time: 0,01
There was 1 failure:
1) TestX
java.lang.Exception: No runnable metods
at org.junit.internal.runners.TestClassMethodsRunner.testAborted
(TestClassMethodsRunner.java:42)
at.....

.
.
.


I assume my classes (both the class X and TestX) must be instrumented
in some way to make this work? I am totally new to JUnit, so maybe
You clould show me how to instrument those classes?


Here they are:






public class TestX {
public static void main (String args[]){
X y = new X();
System.out.println(y.met(1));
}
}


///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////




public class X {
public int met (int number) {
int num = number;
if (num > 1)
return num*2;
else{
return 666;
}
}
}


////////////////////////////////////////////////////////


maybe I shall put in @Test somewhere in the code above?


Both files are placed in a different directory then JUnit directory?
Is that a problem?


Thanx for you're good help.

Magnus




--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Lasse Koskela" <lasse.koskela@...>
wrote:
>
> Hi Magnus,
>
> On 10/20/06, t703093 <t703093@...> wrote:
> > My path looks like this:
> >
> > C:\Programfiler\Java\jdk1.5.0_03
> >
\bin;c:\Perl\bin;C:\WINDOWS\system32;C:\WINDOWS;C:\WINDOWS\System32
> > \Wbem;c:\xalan\xalan-j_2_7_0\xml-apis.jar;c:\xalan\xalan-j_2_7_0
> > \xercesImpl.jar.;C:\Programfiler\IDM Computer
Solutions\UltraEdit-
> > 32;C:\WINDOWS\system32;C:\WINDOWS;C:\WINDOWS\System32
> >
\Wbem;C:\WINDOWS\DPDrv;C:\WINDOWS\system32;C:\WINDOWS;C:\WINDOWS\Syste
> > m32\Wbem;C:\WINDOWS\DPDrv;C:\junit4.1\junit-
4.1.jar;C:\build\classes;
>
> Note that you don't need to include your .jar files and source
folders
> in PATH. They're just polluting your environment for no benefit
> whatsoever.
>
>
> On 10/20/06, t703093 <t703093@...> wrote:
> > and my classpath looks like this:
> >
> > C:\Ifi\Java\easyIO.jar;C:\junit4.1\junit-
> > 4.1.jar;C:\build\classes;C:\Ifi\Java;;.
>
> Looks good: you've got the junit.jar in there.
>
>
> On 10/20/06, t703093 <t703093@...> wrote:
> > I can run javac with these settings, but not junit.
> >
> > still problems and the same error:
> > NoClassDefFoundError: org.junit.runner.JUnitCore
>
> How about if you set the classpath explicitly like this:
>
> java -classpath
> C:\Ifi\Java\easyIO.jar;C:\junit4.1\junit-
4.1.jar;C:\build\classes;C:\Ifi\Java;.
> org.junit.runner.JUnitCore
>
> -Lasse-
>
